results.adx_keywords: Elections, District Attorneys;Prisons and Prisoners;Voting and Voters;Politics and Government;Boudin, Chesa;Police Department (San Francisco, Calif);San Francisco (Calif)
results.title: Voters in San Francisco topple the city’s progressive district attorney, Chesa Boudin.
results.abstract: Mr. Boudin, who had eliminated cash bail and sought to reduce the prison population, was removed in a vote that is set to reverberate through Democratic politics across the country.

media.caption: District Attorney Chesa Boudin with family members in San Francisco after being recalled Tuesday night.

results.adx_keywords: Uvalde, Tex, Shooting (May 24, 2022);Gun Control;United States Politics and Government;Biden, Joseph R Jr;McConaughey, Matthew;Uvalde (Tex)
results.title: Matthew McConaughey Meets Biden and Pleads for an End to Gun Violence
results.abstract: The Uvalde, Texas, native appeared in the White House briefing room and called for new gun control measures.

results.adx_keywords: Threats and Threatening Messages;Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Abortion;United States Politics and Government;Kavanaugh, Brett M;Roske, Nicholas John;Supreme Court (US);Montgomery County (Md);Maryland
results.byline: By Maria Cramer and Jesus Jiménez
results.title: Armed Man Traveled to Justice Kavanaugh’s Home to Kill Him, Officials Say
results.abstract: The man, Nicholas John Roske, 26, said he was upset about the shooting in Uvalde, Texas, and impending decisions on abortion and guns, a federal affidavit says.

media.caption: Justice Brett M. Kavanaugh in 2019. An armed man was arrested near his home in Chevy Chase, Md., early Wednesday.

results.adx_keywords: Presidential Election of 2020;Storming of the US Capitol (Jan, 2021);United States Politics and Government;Project Democracy;Kushner, Jared;Trump, Donald J;Trump, Ivanka
results.title: How Jared Kushner Washed His Hands of Donald Trump Before Jan. 6
results.abstract: Mr. Kushner’s role in the final months of the Trump White House could come into sharp relief once the committee investigating the attack on the Capitol opens hearings.

media.caption: Jared Kushner’s decision to withdraw from the most consequential moment of the Trump presidency left few effective counterweights to plotters looking to subvert the 2020 election.

results.title: Two new versions of Omicron are gaining ground in the U.S., according to C.D.C. estimates.
results.abstract: The spread of the subvariants adds more uncertainty to the trajectory of the pandemic in the United States.
org_facet: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

media.caption: Conducting a coronavirus test at in Durham, N.C., last month.
media.copyright: Veasey Conway for The New York Times

results.title: Only one House Republican who voted for a Jan. 6 inquiry has lost a primary so far.
results.abstract: Eleven of 14 incumbents have won their primaries, with two contests still to be determined. Primary challenges still await a dozen more.

media.caption: Representative Liz Cheney’s race in Wyoming has drawn national attention, and a Trump-endorsed opponent.
media.copyright: Stephen Speranza for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);United States International Relations;Foreign Aid;Putin, Vladimir V;European Union;North Atlantic Treaty Organization;Ukraine;Russia
results.title: The Ukraine War Still Holds Surprises. The Biggest May Be for Putin.
results.abstract: Russia’s president probably feels that he’s calling all the shots. But big wars are strange things that can take totally unpredicted turns.

results.adx_keywords: Company Reports;Shopping and Retail;Consumer Behavior;Standard & Poor's 500-Stock Index;Target Corporation;Walmart Stores Inc
results.byline: By Melina Delkic and Jason Karaian
results.title: Target will take a profit hit to clear out inventory that shoppers don’t want.
results.abstract: The move shows how inflation and changing consumer behavior are souring the business outlook for many retailers.

media.caption: “Trends have changed rapidly since the beginning of the year,” Target said in a news release.
media.copyright: Cornell Watson for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: your-feed-science;Monkeypox;Masks;Smallpox;Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.title: Monkeypox Can Be Airborne, Too
results.abstract: An abrupt change in C.D.C. guidance underscores a little-known phenomenon: On occasion, monkeypox can be transmitted through aerosols, similar to the coronavirus.
org_facet: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

media.caption: Scientists say that the monkeypox virus can be airborne, although that route of transmission is only a small contributor to its overall spread.
media.copyright: Erika P. Rodriguez for The New York Times

results.byline: By Zolan Kanno-Youngs and Jeanna Smialek
results.title: White House Struggles to Talk About the ‘Problem From Hell’
results.abstract: Inflation is upending voter confidence and posing a glaring political liability that looms over the Biden administration’s major policy decisions.

media.caption: President Biden regularly talks about the pain inflation is inflicting on households as rising prices pose a political risk.

results.adx_keywords: Real Estate and Housing (Residential);Easton (Pa);Northampton County (Pa)
results.title: Easton, Pa.: A Gritty River Town Being Transformed
results.abstract: For more than a decade, this historic city has been a refuge for those who want more real estate for their money, along with lower property taxes.

results.title: An Uvalde pediatrician says he will ‘never forget what I saw’ after the shooting.
results.abstract: Dr. Roy Guerrero described to members of Congress on Wednesday the horrors he experienced as he treated wounded and dying students.

results.adx_keywords: Colon and Colorectal Cancer;Drugs (Pharmaceuticals);Clinical Trials;Research;Immunotherapy;Dostarlimab (Drug);American Society of Clinical Oncology;New England Journal of Medicine;GlaxoSmithKline PLC
results.title: A Cancer Trial’s Unexpected Result: Remission in Every Patient
results.abstract: The study was small, and experts say it needs to be replicated. But for 18 people with rectal cancer, the outcome led to “happy tears.”

media.caption: Sascha Roth, the first patient in the trial, unexpectedly learned she had rectal cancer in 2019. Her gastroenterologist, she recalled, told her during a sigmoidoscopy, “Oh no. I was notexpecting this!”
media.copyright: Shuran Huang for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Clinical Trials;Breast Cancer;Drugs (Pharmaceuticals);Chemotherapy;Research;AstraZeneca PLC;American Society of Clinical Oncology;New England Journal of Medicine;Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center;Cleveland Clinic;Daiichi Sankyo Co
results.title: Breast Cancer Drug Trial Results in ‘Unheard-Of’ Survival
results.abstract: For some patients with metastatic tumors not significantly affected by other forms of chemotherapy, the treatment halted their cancer’s growth.

media.caption: A colored scanning electron micrograph of breast cancer cells. Patients treated with the new drug trastuzumab deruxtecan survived for 23.9 months.

results.adx_keywords: Campaign Finance;Ethics and Official Misconduct;United States Politics and Government;Boebert, Lauren;Republican Party;American Muckrakers PAC;Colorado
results.title: Colorado to Examine Lauren Boebert’s Mileage Claims and Tax Liens
results.abstract: The state’s attorney general has referred for review a fraud complaint from the group that targeted Representative Madison Cawthorn, in a sign of trouble for the first-term congresswoman.

media.caption: Aides to Representative Lauren Boebert, Republican of Colorado, said on Wednesday that she had accounted for the mileage she logged on the campaign trail in 2020.

results.adx_keywords: Amusement and Theme Parks;Weddings and Engagements;Disneyland Paris;Walt Disney Company
results.title: Disney Apologizes After Employee Thwarts Marriage Proposal
results.abstract: A man had been planning for months to pop the question at Disneyland Paris, but the employee instead snatched the ring and ushered the couple off a stage.

media.caption: The main public entrance to Disneyland Paris.
media.copyright: Alex Cretey-Systermans for The New York Times

results.byline: By Katie Benner and Juliet Macur
results.title: Nassar Victims Suing F.B.I. for Early Investigative Failures
results.abstract: The plaintiffs say the former U.S.A. Gymnastics doctor abused them after the bureau failed to act. The suits come after the Justice Department declined to prosecute the agents accused of bungling the inquiry.

media.caption: The U.S. gymnasts, from left, Simone Biles, McKayla Maroney, Aly Raisman and Maggie Nichols testifying on Capitol Hill in September. The four are among the more than 90 plaintiffs in the suits.

results.byline: By Christopher Flavelle and Bryan Tarnowski
results.title: As the Great Salt Lake Dries Up, Utah Faces An ‘Environmental Nuclear Bomb’
results.abstract: Climate change and rapid population growth are shrinking the lake, creating a bowl of toxic dust that could poison the air around Salt Lake City.

media.copyright: Bryan Tarnowski for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Spas;Massage;Sexual Harassment;Sex Crimes;Suits and Litigation (Civil);Nondisclosure Agreements;Women and Girls;Football;Watson, Deshaun (1995- );Houston Texans;Cleveland Browns;National Football League
results.title: How the Texans and a Spa Enabled Deshaun Watson’s Troubling Behavior
results.abstract: Watson met at least 66 women for massages over a 17-month period, far more than previously known. He had help from the Houston Texans, including nondisclosure agreements, in making appointments.

results.adx_keywords: Theater;Actors and Actresses;#MeToo Movement;Wages and Salaries;Labor and Jobs;Bullies;Edelstein, Gordon;Fosse, Bob;Horovitz, Israel;Kazan, Elia;Robbins, Jerome;Rudin, Scott
results.title: Is It Finally Twilight for the Theater’s Sacred Monsters?
results.abstract: Many of the “great men” who helped America create its classics, its institutions and its own acting style were tyrants. We need to cut them loose.
